member.name: ICodecAPI.GetAllSettings

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetAllSettings method gets the codec's current properties and writes them to a stream.

member.param: Pointer to the IStream interface of the stream.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ICodecAPI.GetDefaultValue

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetDefaultValue method gets the default value of a codec property.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.
Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the default value. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The specified property does not have a default value.

member.name: ICodecAPI.GetParameterRange

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetParameterRange method gets the range of values for a codec property.
This method applies only to properties whose values form a linear range.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to query. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.
Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the minimum value of the property. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.
Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the maximum value of the property. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.

param.name: SteppingDelta
param.para: Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the stepping delta, which defines the valid increments from ValueMin to ValueMax. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.
If the VARIANT type is VT_EMPTY, any increment is valid.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The property supports a list of possible values, not a linear range.

member.name: ICodecAPI.GetParameterValues

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetParameterValues method gets the list of possible values for a codec property.
This method applies only to properties that support a list of possible values, as opposed to a linear range.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to query. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

Receives a pointer to an array of VARIANT types. The array contains the list of values that the encoder supports for this property. The caller must free each VARIANT by calling VariantClear. The caller must also free the array by calling CoTaskMemFree.
Receives the number of elements in the Values array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The property supports a range of values, not a list.

member.name: ICodecAPI.GetValue

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetValue method gets the current value of a codec property.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.
Pointer to a VARIANT that receives the value of the property. The caller must free the VARIANT by calling VariantClear.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The property does not currently have a value.

member.name: ICodecAPI.IsModifiable

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IsModifiable method queries whether a codec property can be changed, given the codec's current configuration.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The value of this property cannot be changed.
The value of this property can be changed.

member.name: ICodecAPI.IsSupported

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IsSupported method queries whether a codec supports a given property.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to query. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: The codec does not support the property.
The codec does not support the property.

member.name: ICodecAPI.RegisterForEvent

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The RegisterForEvent method registers the application to receive events from the codec.

param.name: Api
param.para: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the event. There are three categories of events:

listheader.description: The codec notifies the application when the properties of the codec change. The event data is a list of GUIDs for the properties that changed.

term.b: One of the property GUIDs defined in codecapi.h. (See Codec API Properties.)

listheader.description: The codec notifies the application when the specified property changes. Typically, a codec will support this type of notification for a limited set of properties, if any.

term.b: A proprietary event GUID defined by the codec.

member.param: Pointer to caller-defined data. The application receives this pointer in the lParam1 event parameter.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

listheader.description: Not implemented. The codec does not support event notification, or does not support the event GUID specified in the Api parameter.

member.name: ICodecAPI.SetAllDefaults

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetAllDefaults method resets all codec properties to their default values.

member.returns: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: ICodecAPI.SetAllDefaultsWithNotify

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetAllDefaultsWithNotify method resets all codec properties to their default values, and returns a list of the properties that changed.

member.param: Receives a pointer to an array of GUIDs. The array contains the GUIDs of any properties that changed as a result of this method call. The caller must free the array by calling CoTaskMemFree.
Receives the number of elements in the ChangedParam array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ICodecAPI.SetAllSettings

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetAllSettings method reads codec properties from a stream and sets them on the codec.

member.param: Pointer to the IStream interface of the stream.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ICodecAPI.SetAllSettingsWithNotify

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetAllSettingsWithNotify method reads codec properties from a stream, sets them on the codec, and returns a list of the properties that changed.

member.param: Pointer to the IStream interface of the stream.
Receives a pointer to an array of GUIDs. The array contains the GUIDs of any properties that changed as a result of this method call. The caller must free the array by calling CoTaskMemFree.
Receives the number of elements in the ChangedParam array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ICodecAPI.SetValue

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetValue method sets the value of a codec property.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to set. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.
Pointer to a VARIANT that contains the new value for the property.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ICodecAPI.SetValueWithNotify

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetValueWithNotify method sets a property on a codec and returns a list of other properties that changed as a result.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the property to set. For a list of standard codec properties, see Codec API Properties.
Pointer to a VARIANT that contains the new value for the property.
Receives a pointer to an array of GUIDs. The array contains the GUIDs of any properties that changed as a result of this method call. The caller must free the array by calling CoTaskMemFree.
Receives the number of elements in the ChangedParam array.

returns.para: This method can return one of these values.

member.name: ICodecAPI.UnregisterForEvent

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The UnregisterForEvent method unregisters the application for a specified encoder event.

member.param: Pointer to a GUID that specifies the event.
member.returns: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, it returns an HRESULT error code.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The ICodecAPI interface sets and retrieves settings on an encoder or decoder filter.
summary.blockquote: [!Note] APIs declared in strmif.h are not supported for Universal Windows Platform (UWP) apps. To use ICodecAPI in a UWP app, use the version declared in .
